heroSlides.title: Empowering Communities Through Credit Unions
heroSlides.subtext: Building stronger financial futures for Ghanaians through cooperative banking and community-driven financial services.

heroSlides.title: Your Financial Partner
heroSlides.subtext: Discover how credit unions provide accessible banking, loans, and savings solutions tailored to your community's needs.

heroSlides.title: Strengthening Ghana's Economy
heroSlides.subtext: Supporting local businesses and individuals with cooperative financial services that drive economic growth and prosperity.

newsArticles.title: CUA Announces New Research Center for Sustainable Technology
newsArticles.excerpt: CUA Ghana is establishing a new research center focused on sustainable technology solutions for credit unions.
newsArticles.content:
The Credit Union Association (CUA) of Ghana is proud to announce the establishment of a new research center dedicated to sustainable technology solutions for credit unions across the country.

This initiative aims to enhance the technological capabilities of credit unions, enabling them to serve their members more efficiently and compete in the modern financial landscape.

newsArticles.title: Cardinals Basketball Team Advances to Championship Finals
newsArticles.excerpt: The CUA Cardinals basketball team has advanced to the championship finals after a stunning victory.
newsArticles.content: The CUA Cardinals basketball team has made history by advancing to the championship finals. The team's dedication and teamwork have paid off in spectacular fashion.

newsArticles.title: Spring 2025 Registration Opens for All Students
newsArticles.excerpt: Registration for Spring 2025 training programs is now open to all credit union professionals.
newsArticles.content: CUA Ghana is pleased to announce that registration for Spring 2025 training programs through CUTRAC is now open. Members can register for various professional development courses.

newsArticles.title: Distinguished Alumni Awards Ceremony This Weekend
newsArticles.excerpt: Join us this weekend for the annual Alumni Awards Ceremony celebrating outstanding credit union leaders.
newsArticles.content: The annual Alumni Awards Ceremony will take place this weekend, honoring outstanding leaders in the credit union movement who have made significant contributions to financial inclusion in Ghana.

newsArticles.title: New Library Hours Extended for Final Exams Period
newsArticles.excerpt: Resource center hours have been extended during the final exams period to support credit union training participants.
newsArticles.content: To better support our training participants during the final examination period, the CUA resource center has extended its operating hours. The center will now be open until 10 PM on weekdays.

events.title: Financial Literacy Training
events.shortDescription: Comprehensive training program for small business owners
events.description:
Comprehensive training program for small business owners to improve financial management skills and access to credit union services.

This program covers budgeting, financial planning, loan management, and understanding credit union membership benefits.

events.title: Agricultural Development Program
events.shortDescription: Supporting local farmers with microfinance solutions
events.description:
Supporting local farmers with microfinance solutions and modern farming techniques to boost agricultural productivity.

Learn about agricultural loans, farm business management, and cooperative farming models.

events.title: Women Empowerment Initiative
events.shortDescription: Empowering women entrepreneurs through access to credit
events.description:
Empowering women entrepreneurs through access to credit, business training, and cooperative banking solutions.

This initiative focuses on providing women with the financial tools and knowledge needed to grow their businesses and achieve financial independence.

partners.name: ACCOSCA
partners.description: African Confederation of Co-operative Savings and Credit Association - The apex organization for credit union movements in Africa.

partners.name: Canadian Co-operative Association
partners.description: National association representing co-operative enterprises in Canada, providing technical support and capacity building.

partners.description: Representative body for credit unions in Ireland, supporting international credit union development.

partners.name: KAD
partners.description: Partner organization supporting credit union development initiatives across West Africa.

partners.name: SEND Ghana
partners.description: Social Enterprise Development Foundation - Supporting community-based development initiatives across Ghana.

partners.name: Sparkassenstiftung
partners.description: Savings Banks Foundation for International Cooperation - German foundation supporting financial sector development worldwide.

partners.name: WOCCU
partners.description: World Council of Credit Unions - Global trade association and development agency for credit unions.

creditUnions.name: Ghana Police Credit Union
creditUnions.description: The Ghana Police Credit Union serves members of the Ghana Police Service and their families, providing comprehensive financial services including savings, loans, and investment products.

creditUnions.name: Ghana Education Service Credit Union
creditUnions.description: Serving educators across Ghana, the GES Credit Union is one of the largest and most respected credit unions in the country.

creditUnions.name: Armed Forces Credit Union
creditUnions.description: The Armed Forces Credit Union provides financial services to military personnel and their families.

creditUnions.name: Health Service Workers Credit Union
creditUnions.description: Dedicated to serving healthcare workers across Ghana with accessible financial services.

creditUnions.name: Ghana Ports and Harbours Credit Union
